title: 15.1 Choosing between jobs - hv12
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor havo en vwo, leerjaar 1 en 2. Dit is thema 15 'Jobs'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Choosing between jobs. In deze les wordt er aandacht besteed aan droombanen en personeelsadvertenties. In de grammaticaopdracht gaat het over 'active and passive' zinnen.

items.content:
The subject of this double period is jobs.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • What would you like to do after leaving school?
  • What do you have to do to get a job?
  • Write down a list of jobs in English.
Step activity aim time
introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1

listening
Dream job

 You can understand a video in which people are talking about their dream job and answer questions about it. 15
Step 2

reading
Looking for a job

 You can understand job advertisements and answer questions about them. 15
Step 3 vocabulary You can understand and use a vocabulary about jobs. 15
Step 4

grammar
Active and passive

 You can understand active and passive sentences. 15
Step 5 speaking
My dream job		 You can have a discussion about dream jobs. 10
Step 6 writing
Real versus dream		 You can write about jobs. 15
Step 7 evaluation Reflecting on what you have learnt. 05

Dream job

You are going to watch a video with 16 people talking about their real job and their dream job.

  • Watch the video and do assignment 1.
  • Read the questions.
  • Watch the video again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Download the worksheet and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

Worksheet: 15.1 Choosing between jobs - Listening
Maak een kopie van het werkblad in je eigen omgeving (Bestand - Een kopie maken...) of download het werkblad (Bestand - Downloaden als).​

items.content:
Looking for a job

You are going to read two job advertisements.

  • Read the advertisements and do assignment 1.
  • Read the advertisements again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Download the worksheet and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

Worksheet: 15.1 Choosing between jobs - Reading
Maak een kopie van het werkblad in je eigen omgeving (Bestand - Een kopie maken...) of download het werkblad (Bestand - Downloaden als).​

Advertisement 1

TEACHING ASSISTANT

Required from: November 2020 - Term time only, four mornings weekly.

We are looking for a caring and enthusiastic teaching assistant to work in a Y3 classroom to work alongside children who require extra support. Experience of working with children is essential. You will be part of a friendly and committed staff team and we shall offer opportunities to help you develop professionally.

Please telephone Jane Hannibal, School Secretary for further details. Visits are welcomed. Letters of application and CV with the details of 2 referees should be sent to Liz Neville, Head teacher by October 14.

St. Mary's Junior School

Heath Drive, Ware, Herts

SG12 ORL

Advertisement 2

CONTRACTS MANAGER

Diamond PLC has been providing a quality service for over 25 years, specialising in refurbishment and major alterations for Local Authorities & Housing Associations in the London area.

Our continued success is due to the commitment of our dedicated team of professionals. We are looking for an experienced Contracts Manager, able to demonstrate the drive necessary to lead a team of Surveyors, Site Managers and Trades, reporting to the Contracts Director.

You will be responsible for controlling projects using the company's management control process and our fully computerised ICT system.

This is a great opportunity for an individual with a proven track record of delivering projects on time & within budget whilst able to maintain our mission statement of 'Building Quality on Time'.

If you feel this is the challenge for you, please apply in writing with a full CV to:

Sarah Curry

HR Department

Diamond Plc52

Stamford Road

London

N15 4PZ

prompt.body: When is the teaching assistant required?

content.body: Four times per week in the morning.

prompt.body: What kind of children will the assistant be working with?

content.body: Children who are top of the class.
Children who can't go to school.

prompt.body: What benefits does the school promise?
How can you apply for this job?

content.body: An application letter with CV and two referees.

prompt.body: Who can give you extra information about the job?

content.body: Both Liz Neville and Jane Hannibal.

prompt.body: What kind of company is looking for a contracts manager?
What information about this company do you get?

content.body: They have been working for nearly 25 years.
They have been working for exactly 25 years.
They have been working for more than 25 years.

prompt.body: What kind of manager are they looking for?

content.body: A manager who leads different types of workers.
A manager who knows how to use ICT.

prompt.body: What is special about this job?

content.body: You don't need much experience but a lot of enhousiasm.
You have to be able to use controlling systems.
You have to be experienced and in for a challenge.

prompt.body: How can you apply for this job?

content.body: You need to write an application letter.
You need to fill in an application form on the Internet.
You need to tape an application video.

items.content:
• Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

Woordenlijst Choosing between jobs

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.

Choose from: application letter - applied - development - experience - explorer - in writing - independently - keyboarding skills - nurse - park ranger - requirements - teacher - veterinarian

  1. I would like to work with animals, so I think I want to become a .
  2. If you want to work in a hospital you can better become a .
  3. What are the to become a tour guide?
  4. I don't know how to start my for this job.
  5. The only I have is working as a volonteer.
  6. If you want to work in an office you need .
  7. My friend for three jobs at the same time.
  8. I like to work outside in the woods, so my dream is to be a .
  9. If you like to work with children you might want to become a .
  10. I like travelling a lot so maybe I want to be an .

items.content:
Situation 2: My dream job

What would you like to do when you finish school? What do you need to do to get a dream job? That is what you are going to talk about.

On your own think about:

  • What is your dream job? Why?
  • What do you like about it?
  • Is there anything you do not like about your dream job?

In your group discuss about:

  • Your dream job.
  • Possible advantages and disadvantages.
  • In your group, who do you think has the best dream job? Why?

Real job versus dream job

You are going to write about your (summer) job in English.
If you have no job, use being a student as a job.

Task:

  • Write a comparison between your real job and your dream job.
  • Write what you like about your real job and your dreamjob, but also what you do not like.
  • Write in between 100 and 150 words.

Ask your teacher how to hand the task in.

Good luck!

What have you learnt in this double period?

Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?

columns.content: 15.1 Choosing between jobs - hv12
